page.title: 15EDUCATION IN NORTH HOLMWOOD
page.content: There are three different types of school in the area. Goodwyns First (120 pupils aged 5_8) and Goodwyns middle (170 pupils aged 8_12) these are funded by Surrey County Council. St.Johns First (60 pupils aged 5_8) gets some of its money from the Church Of England. All schools need to raise money from sponsored events,fairs,jumble sales etc. to buy extras such as musical,P.E,video or computer equipment. Many teachers have been taking action this year to protest about the size of their salaries. Strikes have affected both the Goodwyns schools and some teachers are refusing to attend parent and staff mettings. All staff interviewed think that the greatest change in primary education this year is the growing use of computers.
